fields.name: current_values
fields.description:
Current valuation and best value for home from multiple AVM vendors. 
When "source" parameter is omitted, return current valuation from all vendors. 
Supported values for "source" parameter: 
+ corelogic 
+ collateral 
+ quantarium 
When "status" parameter is omitted, return valuations with any statuses.

fields.name: historical_values
fields.description:
Historical valuation from multiple AVM vendors. 
When "source" parameter is omitted, return historical valuation from all vendors. 
Day is not considered when fetching estimates using "date_range" parameter.
When "date_range" parameter is omitted, return all historical valuation of the requested source.
Supported values for "source" parameter: 
+ corelogic 
+ collateral 
+ quantarium 
When "status" parameter is omitted, return valuations with any statuses.

fields.name: forecast_values
fields.description:
Forecast valuation from multiple AVM vendors. 
When "source" parameter is omitted, return forecast valuation from all vendors. 
When "max_date" parameter is omitted, return forecast valuation for 12 months from current valuation. 
Supported values for "source" parameter: 
+ corelogic 
+ collateral 
+ quantarium 
When "status" parameter is omitted, return valuations with any statuses.

types.name: DateTimeString
types.description:
This scalar allows date string to accept either a date as string ("2019-02-17T03:00:00Z") 
  or with keyword ($now / $nowUTC / $today) and offset. 
  
  Offset is defined as accepted by moment.duration shorthand format with out a P in the beginning.
  
  Ordering should be in the decreasing period length, Y year should always be before M month.
  
  Offset period letters defined in decreasing period length below
  
    - Y: years
    - M: months (before time separator T) or minutes (after time separator T)
    - D: days
    - T: time separator
    - H: hours
    - M: minutes (after time separator T)
    - S: seconds
  
  - In order to add period just add the number (example: $now7D)
  - In order to subtract include the subtraction sign (example: $now-9D)
  
  The time offset part is separated by T.
  
  Example of input are given below
  
  - Local Date Time with all periods 5 years 2 months 3 days 4 hours 5 minutes 6 seconds 
  
    '$now5Y2M3DT4H5M6S'
    
  - Local Date Time 5 months 9 days from current time 
    
    '$now5M9D'
    
  - UTC Date Time 2 years 9 H before current UTC time 
  
    '$nowUTC-2YT9H'
    
  - UTC Date only 30 Days from current date
  
    '$today+30D'

histogram_segments
inputFields.description:
Perform a histogram segment aggregation on a given field.
Multiplier is used to calculate bucket interval based on median value of field.
Can be used with any other aggregation present.
```
Example:
  histogram_segments: {
    field: list_price,
    multiplier: 2,
    buckets: 30
  }
```

types.name: SearchLocation
types.description: Search location based on free text address string, buffer in miles (optional) and boundary (optional)

inputFields.name: location
inputFields.description:
A free text string that will be parsed and sent to underlying API for search
Represents any of these locations:
+ address (123 Main St, Seattle, WA, 92281)
+ city (Seattle WA or Seattle, WA)
+ duplicate city with county name (Salem, Saline, AR)
+ duplicate city without county name (Salem, AR). Here county will be taken from top result of Parser API
+ state (WA or Washington)
+ neighborhood (Manhattan, New York City, NY)
+ county (Orange County, CA)
+ postal code (90210)
+ school (Beverly Hills High, CA)
+ school district (Los Angeles School District, CA)

inputFields.name: buffer
inputFields.description:
A value representing how much to expand the location/boundary when
doing a search (expressed in miles) buffer, limited up to 50 miles

inputFields.name: viewport_boundary
inputFields.description:
Additional boundary to limit search results too.
Useful when viewing just a portion of a data belonging to specified location on a map.


Example: Polygon
```
   viewport_boundary: {
      type: "Polygon",
      coordinates: [[
         [-122.31585502624512, 47.64879512494596],
         [-122.29268074035646, 47.64879512494596],
         [-122.29268074035646, 47.66524284745839],
         [-122.31585502624512, 47.66524284745839],
         [-122.31585502624512, 47.64879512494596]
      ]]}
```

Example: Envelope
```
   viewport_boundary: {
      type: "envelope",
      coordinates: [
         [-122.31585502624512, 47.64879512494596],
         [-122.29268074035646, 47.66524284745839]
      ]}
```

types.name: Preset
types.description:
Preset for geo_insights endpoint used as input parameter to find recommended geos  
currently supported values 
+ similarity - filters and popularity both are used to find recommended geos 
+ neighborhood_discovery - only filters are used to find recommended geos 
If Preset is similarity or no preset value is passed then geo_search_method is passed to Market Trends API as expansion 
If Preset is neighborhood_discovery then geo_serch_method parameter is not passed to Market Trends API

enumValues.name: neighborhood_discovery
enumValues.description: filters are used to find recommended geos

enumValues.name: similarity
enumValues.description: filters and popularity both are used to find similar geos

types.name: GroupBy
types.description:
GroupBy is used to group geo_insights endpoint results based on selected criteria 
currently supported values 
+ property_type - group attributes for different property types(land, single_family, multi_family, condos, townhomes, condo_townhome_rowhome_coop, apartment, townhomes, duplex_triplex, coop, home)

inputFields.name: test_mode
inputFields.description:
Used for testing. Set to “1” to activate test mode. Set to “0” or blank when sending of leads is desired. While in test mode all parameter validation and error reporting is enabled, but the sending of leads is disabled. When in test mode the response includes the phrase "Test Mode" along with the normal Success or Error indication. For example:

"Test Successful (Test Mode)" or "Error: 101 (Test Mode)"

inputFields.name: live
inputFields.description: Must be set to "1" to enable sending leads. If absent or not set to "1" then leads will not be sent, and the behavior will be the same as if the TestMode parameter is set to 1 as indicated above.

inputFields.name: move_type
inputFields.description: Set to "FSvc" for Full Service / Set to "SSvc" to Self Service

inputFields.name: move_size
inputFields.description:
Values:Studio (1500 lbs)
1 Bedroom (2000 lbs)
2 Bedrooms (5000 lbs)
2-3 Bedrooms (7500 lbs)
3 Bedrooms (10000 lbs)
4 Bedrooms (15000 lbs)
5 Bedrooms (20000 lbs)
Note: only numerical weight value is sent in the HTTP request. Example:  MoveSize=5000

types.name: RentAmountModel
types.description: Rent Amount Model (RAM) estimates the monthly rent for a residential property.

fields.name: processed_date
fields.description:
Represents the date on which the rent amount data was processed and recorded in the system.
Indicates when the rental amount information was last processed or refreshed.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
Represents the estimated rent amount for a specific property. 
This value is derived using CoreLogic's proprietary models, which analyze various factors to estimate the expected rental price.
Purpose of the value Field:
Estimated Rent Price: Provides a predicted monthly rent amount for the property based on market conditions.
Market Comparisons: Helps in benchmarking against similar properties in the area.
Investment & Pricing Decisions: Used by property managers, investors, and lenders to assess rental potential.
Dynamic Updates: The value may be recalculated as new data (such as market trends, property characteristics, or economic factors) becomes available.

fields.name: value_low
fields.description:
Represents the lower bound of the estimated rent range for a given property. 
It provides a conservative estimate of what the property could rent for, considering market fluctuations and uncertainties.
Purpose of the value_low Field:
Lower Confidence Interval: Indicates the lower limit of the predicted rent range, accounting for factors like property condition, location demand, and market variability.
Risk Assessment: Helps investors, property managers, and lenders assess potential downside scenarios in rental pricing.
Comparative Analysis: Allows users to see the range of potential rent values, helping with pricing strategy and negotiations.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Useful for setting competitive rental prices while considering market risks.

fields.name: value_high
fields.description:
Represents the upper bound of the estimated rent range for a property. 
It provides a more optimistic estimate of potential rent, considering favorable market conditions and property attributes.
Purpose of the value_high Field:
Upper Confidence Interval: Indicates the maximum expected rent value based on CoreLogic’s predictive modeling.
Best-Case Scenario Assessment: Helps property owners and investors understand the highest possible rent they might achieve.
Market Analysis: Useful for comparing rent estimates across similar properties and setting competitive pricing strategies.
Risk Mitigation: Provides a range of rental values (with value_low and value_high) to help users make informed decisions based on market conditions.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

args.description: Number of digits after the decimal point. Must be in the range 0 - 10, inclusive

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip

args.name: if

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
